alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 5:11PM MST until July 24 at 8:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pima. * WHEN...Until 715 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 511 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Gu Vo Wash, Sikort Chuapo Wash, Siovi Shuatak Wash, Growler Wash, Kuakatch Wash, Gunsight Wash, San Cristobal Wash, Ali Chuk Wash, Aguajita Wash, Pia Oik Wash, Cuerda de Lena and Alamo Wash. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument, Ali Chugk, Why, Gunsight and Lukeville. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
